activities.loc: Br 10 - Law Enforcement Center - West Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn A Thompson

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Atty Jamie McClendon
Order Allowing Withdraw
Status conference on October 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:46 AM Defendant Shawn A Thompson in court.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for Shawn A Thompson.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Defense requests plea date. 
Defendant indicates he wants a new attorney and has talked to Atty Samuels about it, Atty Mcclendon is willing to take the case. 

BTC: Court cannot appoint Atty Mcclendon as the defendant is eligible for SPD. Atty Samuels can withdraw. SPD to appoint a new attorney. Atty Samuels to submit an order.
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Racine County Alternatives Program

9:13 AM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shawn A Thompson in court.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for Shawn A Thompson. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Defense has written discovery and has reviewed it with his client, still needs time to review the digital and requests one final status date. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Racine County Alternatives Program

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Atty Jeremy Samuels
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 4/21/2022 to modify RCAP testing to only when defendant comes to court
NG plea entered.

9:33 AM Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shawn A Thompson in court.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for Shawn A Thompson. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Atty Samuels asks for another date for him to be appointed on 22CF271. 
BTC: Matter set over contested prelim in 22CF271. Finding of good cause to waive time limits. 
While going through scheduling the matter would have had to been set out over a month. Parties go off the record for defense counsel to speak to his client. 
Back on the record with same appearances as above. 
Parties are prepared to proceed with Atty Samuels appearing as a friend of the court as he is representing Mr. Thompson on the other file. 
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over. 
Defense requests to be heard on bond in regards to RCAP. 
State indicates they can proceed there are not victim issues. 
Defense requests reporting be modified to once a month or just when he has court due to living out of county.
State doesnt object. 
BTC: BOND: To test at RCAP when he comes to court
Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on May 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:51 AM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Shawn A Thompson appeared in court, Attorney Erin J. Preston for Shawn A Thompson appeared in court. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense attorney of record is not present at this time. Requests an adjournment. 
BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits on 22CF271 for holding preliminary hearing.
Status conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:45 PM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Shawn A Thompson appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Alexander J. Kostal appeared by video for Shawn A Thompson. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
